alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Haskell; Latimer; Le Flore; Pittsburg; Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 20 at 4:58AM CDT until July 20 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Critical fire weather conditions expected to develop this afternoon... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WINDY CONDITIONS COUPLED WITH VERY DRY FUELS AND EXTREME TEMPERATURES... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...IN Oklahoma, Pushmataha, Choctaw, Pittsburg, Haskell, Latimer, and Le Flore counties. * WIND...South winds gusting to 15 to 20 mph, with gusts of 25 to 30 mph in higher terrain. * HUMIDITY...25 to 35 percent. * TEMPERATURE...105 to 110 degrees. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and may exhibit extreme behavior. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that a dangerous combination of weather conditions and dry vegetation is expected within 24 hours, favoring rapid growth and spread of any wildfires. The primary weather factors include stronger winds, lower humidities, and warmer temperatures.

area.areaDesc: Choctaw; Haskell; Latimer; Le Flore; Pittsburg; Pushmataha
